diseases: Aspartame can cause headaches and allergic reactions in some individuals. It's often considered safe in moderation
but some studies suggest a potential link to health issues.
Sucralose is generally recognized as safe
but some studies suggest it may alter gut bacteria and cause digestive issues.
Saccharin has been linked to bladder cancer in laboratory animals
but extensive studies show it is safe for human consumption in moderation.
Stevia is a natural sweetener and may have health benefits
including lowering blood sugar levels and having antioxidant properties.
Benzoates can cause allergic reactions in some individuals and have been associated with hyperactivity in children.
Sorbates are generally safe but can cause allergic reactions in some people.
Some preservatives may cause allergic reactions or sensitivities
while others are considered safe.
Excessive sugar consumption can lead to obesity
diabetes
and heart disease.
High salt intake can lead to hypertension and increase the risk of heart disease.
Water is essential for life
but excessive consumption can lead to water intoxication.
Wheat can trigger gluten sensitivities or celiac disease in some individuals.
Milk is a good source of calcium and vitamin D but can cause lactose intolerance in some people.
Dextrose is a simple sugar that can spike blood sugar levels if consumed in excess.
Glucose is a primary energy source
but excessive intake can lead to health issues like obesity and diabetes.
Fructose can lead to insulin resistance and fatty liver disease when consumed in large amounts.
Maltodextrin can spike blood sugar levels and should be consumed in moderation by those with diabetes.
Gelatin is safe for most but can cause allergic reactions in some.
Emulsifiers are generally safe but can cause digestive issues in sensitive individuals.
Antioxidants are beneficial for health
reducing oxidative stress and inflammation.
Sorbitol can cause digestive issues in large amounts but is used as a low-calorie sweetener.
Glycerin is generally safe but can cause gastrointestinal distress in high amounts.
Pectin is safe and may have health benefits
including lowering cholesterol levels.
Dextrin can spike blood sugar levels and should be consumed in moderation.
Monoglycerides are generally safe and used as emulsifiers.
Diglycerides are generally safe and used as emulsifiers.
Enzymes are beneficial for digestion and various bodily functions.
